conclusion: To determine if Car A's acceleration changed direction, analyze the v-t graph.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity, represented by the slope of the v-t graph.
Car A's graph consists of two identical arcs.
The arcs are part of a parabolic curve, meaning they are not straight lines.
The slope of the tangent line at any point on the v-t graph gives the instantaneous acceleration.
For a parabolic curve, the slope changes continuously along the curve.
At the start and end points of each arc, the slope can be positive or negative.
If the slope changes sign, it means the acceleration has changed direction.
The critical points are where the slope is zero, indicating a change in direction of acceleration.
For Car A, the graph shows that the slope changes from positive to negative and back to positive at certain points.
Since the slope changes sign at different points, the direction of Car A's acceleration changes within the time interval.
Yes, the direction of Car A's acceleration changed within the time interval of 0 to 4 seconds.
